selected_quotes: A protein associated with neurodegenerative disease also plays a key role in antiviral response
New Cdn study! - ALS gene senataxin links disease to infection susceptibility antiviral transcriptional response
Senataxin suppresses the antiviral transcriptional response and controls viral… #microbiome

citation.abstract: The human helicase senataxin (SETX) has been linked to the neurodegenerative diseases amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS4) and ataxia with oculomotor apraxia (AOA2). Here we identified a role for SETX in controlling the antiviral response. Cells that had undergone depletion of SETX and SETX-deficient cells derived from patients with AOA2 had higher expression of antiviral mediators in response to infection than did wild-type cells. Mechanistically, we propose a model whereby SETX attenuates the activity of RNA polymerase II (RNAPII) at genes stimulated after a virus is sensed and thus controls the magnitude of the host response to pathogens and the biogenesis of various RNA viruses (e.g., influenza A virus and West Nile virus). Our data indicate a potentially causal link among inborn errors in SETX, susceptibility to infection and the development of neurologic disorders.
citation.title: Senataxin suppresses the antiviral transcriptional response and controls viral biogenesis.

news.title: Researchers find new link between neurodegenerative diseases and abnormal immune responses
news.summary: Researchers from McMaster University and the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, New York have discovered that a protein associated with neurodegenerative diseases like ALS also plays an important role in the body's natural antiviral response.

news.title: New link between neurodegenerative diseases, abnormal immune responses found
news.summary: New insight into the link between neurodegenerative disorders and inflammation has been gained by a new study that provides a framework to explore more fully the possibility that viral infection may lead to onset of these diseases.

facebook.title: Senataxin suppresses the antiviral transcriptional response and controls viral biogenesis :...
facebook.summary: Mutations in the gene encoding the helicase senataxin have well established associations with the neurodegenerative disease ALS. Marazzi and colleagues show that senataxin can also attenuate virus-triggered responses by controlling RNA polymerase activity
